org.springframework.core.io.support

Class SpringFactoriesLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.core.io.support.SpringFactoriesLoader

  • public final class SpringFactoriesLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    General purpose factory loading mechanism for internal use within the framework.

    SpringFactoriesLoader loads and instantiates factories of a given type from "META-INF/spring.factories" files which may be present in multiple JAR files in the classpath. The spring.factories file must be in Properties format, where the key is the fully qualified name of the interface or abstract class, and the value is a comma-separated list of implementation class names. For example: 

    example.MyService=example.MyServiceImpl1,example.MyServiceImpl2
    where example.MyService is the name of the interface, and MyServiceImpl1 and MyServiceImpl2 are two implementations.
    Since:
    3.2
    Author:
    Arjen Poutsma, Juergen Hoeller, Sam Brannen

        public static final java.lang.String FACTORIES_RESOURCE_LOCATION

        Can be present in multiple JAR files.

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • loadFactories

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> loadFactories(java.lang.Class<T> factoryClass,
                                                  @Nullable
                                                  java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
        Load and instantiate the factory implementations of the given type from "META-INF/spring.factories", using the given class loader.

        The returned factories are sorted through AnnotationAwareOrderComparator.

        If a custom instantiation strategy is required, use loadFactoryNames(java.lang.Class<?>, java.lang.ClassLoader) to obtain all registered factory names.

        Parameters:
        factoryClass - the interface or abstract class representing the factory
        classLoader - the ClassLoader to use for loading (can be null to use the default)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any factory implementation class cannot be loaded or if an error occurs while instantiating any factory
        See Also:
        loadFactoryNames(java.lang.Class<?>, java.lang.ClassLoader)

      • loadFactoryNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> loadFactoryNames(java.lang.Class<?> factoryClass,
                                                                @Nullable
                                                                java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
        Load the fully qualified class names of factory implementations of the given type from "META-INF/spring.factories", using the given class loader.
        Parameters:
        factoryClass - the interface or abstract class representing the factory
        classLoader - the ClassLoader to use for loading resources; can be null to use the default
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an error occurs while loading factory names
        See Also:
        loadFactories(java.lang.Class<T>, java.lang.ClassLoader)
